--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "billo_ga" <billo@r...> wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> I am looking for a tool that will allow me to focus on a domain and
> only grab a few pages based on content - for example, simple text
> searching criteria.  For instance, I may be only looking for pages
> that contain the word "acre" or "juniper," or only pages that have
> links to more than two .mpeg movies. Of course, the more useful things
> are more complex.
> 

I should probably be more specific here.  I am a forensic pathologist,
and am interested in searching various sites for information and
imagery involving patterned injury of the skin.  I am, for instance,
writing an atlas of patterned injury in order to help people determine
what object was used in an assault (hammer, crowbar, etc.) from the
patterns those objects leave on the skin.

I am interested in searching hardware sites for specific kinds of
implements, and searching medical sites for images of skin injury.

I happen to have some formal training in Computer Science, and can
write code in Java, C++, C, python, perl, and a few others (even --
not to show my age, APL, God help me; I still have a keyboard laying
around for it).  So, I'm happy to write a parser or whatever if I can
get a handle on how to fit it in here (or where to fit it in).

billo
